alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 9:08AM CDT until May 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Muddy Boggy Creek near Farris affecting Atoka County. For the Muddy Boggy Creek...including Farris...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Muddy Boggy Creek near Farris. * WHEN...From this morning to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Low-lying agricultural lands and rural roads along the creek in southeastern Atoka County may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 23.1 feet. - Forecast...The Muddy Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 40.4 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
